channel.title: Getting dizzy when playing the original half life.
channel.description:
'ello.
When playing the original half life series, blue shift and opposing force included, I always get dizzy and get headaches and shit. A little off-topic, but this also happens with the Dutch game "De Blob", the original version. Is it because of the graphics? Is it because of the inaccurate perspective? I don't have epilepsy or something. Please tell me, this doesn't happen with Half life 2 and source games.
PS: I am new.
PPS: Is the though guy smiley supposed to be Gordon Freeman? :freeman:
Signed, a concerned citizen.

item.title: Getting dizzy when playing the original half life.
item.dc:creator: xKirby
item.description:
Well for the original HL1 with the GoldScr engine…try decreasing the gamma. It helped for me.
(I’m new too).

Read full topic

item.title: Getting dizzy when playing the original half life.
item.dc:creator: taxi_evil
item.description:
Rukia:
  • illuminate your room well

This is excellent advice, don’t play in the dark

Ideally there should be no glare on the screen, sort of 90 degrees to your window/light/roaring fire is ideal

item.title: Getting dizzy when playing the original half life.
item.dc:creator: Rukia
item.description:
I have the same simulation sicknes problem.
This could help:

  • playing in window mode
  • illuminate your room well
  • turn off the sound
  • take breaks
  • don’t play when drugged

Maybe the table on this side is also helpfull:

https://user.cs.tu-berlin.de/~edda/gamingsickness.html

Read full topic

item.source: Getting dizzy when playing the original half life.

item.title: Getting dizzy when playing the original half life.
item.dc:creator: taxi_evil
item.description:
Doedel:

I used to go to an internet cafe repeatedly a couple years ago. There was this one computer there that, if I used it, I would subsequently get massive headaches and blind spots and nausea, similar to feelings I got when I was a little kid and shined one of those laser pointers directly into my eye. I don’t know if it could be related.

It’ll be the refresh rate on the monitor. Flickering. I had the same thing once, but it was caused by a strip light

Exactly the same symptoms

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: HumanParadoxx
item.description:
A question: how old are you?

Why: if you are too young, some parts of your nervous system could not be fully developed. I used to get dizzy when I was playng Dark Messiah when I was young

item.title: Getting dizzy when playing the original half life.
item.dc:creator: Bolteh
item.description:
I get seriously sick when playing HL2 and HL2:E1. I’m okay with E2 or any other Source game, though.

I blame the FOV.

Read full topic
item.source: Getting dizzy when playing the original half life.

item.title: Getting dizzy when playing the original half life.
item.dc:creator: Spooboy
item.description:
If the room is spinning, you feel sick, and are disorientated (cant speak, move, etc) then you have have Vertigo. One of the reasons to suspect Vertigo is due to the headaches associated with the dizziness. I suggest going to the doctor for eye/ear exams.

Read full topic
item.source: Getting dizzy when playing the original half life.

item.title: Getting dizzy when playing the original half life.
item.dc:creator: taxi_evil
item.description:
Have a word with your optician is my advice.

It can be caused by flickering, such as fluorescent lights, strobe lighting or the refresh rate of a screen. If Half-Life has a lower frame rate that could be doing it

Read full topic

item.title: Getting dizzy when playing the original half life.
item.dc:creator: RabidMonkey
item.description:
Sounds like simulator sickness, a form of motion sickness brought on by simulations/games…if you feel ill after playing for a while then you should probably take a break.

Do you get sick when you’re a passenger in a car or when you’re on an airplane/boat?

Read full topic
item.source: Getting dizzy when playing the original half life.
